name: Citrus canker
summary: Citrus canker is a highly contagious bacterial disease affecting citrus plants, characterized by lesions on leaves, stems, and fruit, leading to reduced yield and quality.

cause_of_disease.describe: The disease is primarily caused by a bacterium, which infects through wounds or natural openings in the plant.
The bacteria spread via wind-driven rain, where water serves as a medium to transfer the bacteria between plants.
Use of contaminated tools or machinery can contribute to the spread of the disease among citrus orchards.

steps: Ensure regular applications during wetter periods to reduce infections.
Remove and destroy affected trees to prevent further spread
Establish buffer zones to separate infected and non-infected areas.
Plant citrus varieties known for resistance to canker
Regularly monitor for any signs of the disease even in resistant plants.

tips: Regularly inspect citrus trees for early signs of disease and commence treatments promptly.
Ensure good sanitation practices, including disinfecting tools and machinery used in citrus orchards.
Implement windbreaks to minimize the spread of bacteria through rain and wind movement.
